channel.title: Retrograde – A Retro Gaming Podcast
channel.description: Retro games reviewed, the CSICON way.
channel.itunes:summary: Retrograde is a fortnightly retro gaming podcast on the CSICON Network. Each episode focuses on a single game from yesteryear chosen by one of the Retrograde team, who - after playing the game for two weeks - sit down and talk about it, its legacy and overall impact on the gaming world.
channel.itunes:author: The CSICON Network
channel.itunes:subtitle: Retro games reviewed, the CSICON way.

item.title: Retrograde #65: Comix Zone
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description:
Pen this one into your diary, with ink, you know, like a comic book... It’s COMIX ZONE. And no, I didn’t spell that wrong. The Retrograde team lick their thumbs and turn the pages of Comix Zone this week. Show notes and links:
  1. GREEN TROLL FACE - YouTube
  2. Comix Zone - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
  3. Jurassic World - Official Trailer (HD) - YouTube

item.title: Retrograde #64: Tomb Raider 2
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description:
The Retrograde team finally size up one of the Tomb Raider games this week. We will be back flipping, shooting dogs, and accidentally pulling out flares so it promises to be a hoot! Show notes and links:
  • Tomb Raider 2 Speed Run

item.title: Retrograde #61: Road Rash
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description:
There isn't a cream in the world that can cure this rash; it's Road Rash! This week the retrograde team put the pedal to the metal, the four to the floor, and... er... put their seats in the upright position. So scratch that itch with Road Rash and the Retrograde team! Show notes and links:
  1. Road Redemption official website
  2. If David Lynch made a video game, it might look like 'Virginia' | The Verge
  3. A Light In Chorus | A game about navigation, cultural ancestry and sparkly things, by Eliott Johnson and Matthew Warshaw
  4. Asteroid Base // Lovers in a Dangerous Spacetime
  5. A Light In Chorus | A game about navigation, cultural ancestry and sparkly things, by Eliott Johnson and Matthew Warshaw

item.title: Retrograde #60: Grim Fandango
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description:
Episode sixty of Retrograde sees the Retrograde team playing the Lucasarts point and click adventure classic Grim Fandango. Four years in the afterlife is not long enough to discuss Grim Fandango but we will try squeeze it in all into a one hour show. Show notes and links:
  1. Grim Fandango - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
  2. Grim Fandango Puzzle Design Dcoument
  3. Our super awesome VO person this week; Reddhorrock

item.title: Retrograde #59: Planescape: Torment
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description:
Ah; damn son! The Retrograde team are back at it again with this gangster game called Planescape: Torment. Watch us as we steal cars, pick up prostitutes, and bowl with our cousin Vinnie in the world of Liberty City ... Wait; what do you mean it’s a deep, immersive RPG? 80,000 lines of dialogue?! Oh dear lord; this is going to go badly! Show notes and links:
  • Planescape: Torment - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
  • Post without a title
  • Planescape: Torment - Best Mods/Increase Resolution Guide :: Alphabetti Spaghetti
  • Torment: Tides of Numenera - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
  • Torment: Tides of Numenera by inXile entertainment — Kickstarter
  • Because You’re Worthless: The Dark Side Of Indie PR | Puppyblog
  • DansGaming - YouTube

item.title: Retrograde #52: Retromania Special
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: This week, Jack Marshall, Neil Skinner, James MacFadyen, Lysanne Fisher, and Anthony Hobday sit back in front of a live audience and talk nonsense all thanks to the guys at the Retro Aslyum podcast welcoming us to their Retromania event. A slight change for this week's episode as last weekend the attended the RetroMania event in London hosted by Retro Aslyum. This episode was sponsored by Tweaked Audio so make sure to head over and check them out. Use the offer code 'retrograde' for 30% off on your order! A big thanks to Andy over at Cartridge Freaks for providing us with the guest VO this week. Make sure to check out their podcast! item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Ho ho ho! Welcome to this year's Xmas Special of Retrograde! As Xmas rolls in, Jack Marshall, Lysanne Fisher, James MacFadyen, and Anthony Hobday sit down to be merry and discuss the latest generation of consoles. While you're here; why not head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for Retrograde? We'll even send you a free Limited Edition Retrograde Badge from the team! item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode thirty-five of Retrograde where the Retrograde team go quackers for Duck Tales. Jack Marshall, Anthony Hobday, Lysanne Fisher, and James MacFadyen all used to get up early on Saturday mornings glued to the TV in anticipation for the opening credits of Duck Tales, so who better than them to do a podcast on the Nintendo home console classic? Our guest VO in today's episode was from James Handford. Be sure to check out James' blog Randomised Gaming. While you're here why not head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for Retrograde? We'll even send you a free Limited Edition Retrograde Badge! Also remember to follow us on Twitter and Facebook. item.title: Retrograde #28: The Castle of Dr. Brain
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode twenty-eight of Retrograde where, this week, we put on our thinking caps with the educational game The Castle of Dr. Brain. Join me; Jack Marshall and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday, and James MacFadyen as we attempt to solve elementary grade puzzles and challenges as we attempt to become Dr. Brain's new lab assistant. item.title: Retrograde #27: Toejam and Earl in Panic on Funkotron
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.category: Toejam and Earl in Panic on Funkotron
item.description: Welcome to episode twenty-seven of Retrograde, where this we week we take a one-way ticket to groove station and play Toejam and Earl in Panic on Funkotron. Be warned my hip-hop slang is rather wack you might say. Join me; Jack Marshall and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday, and James MacFadyen as we take on the crazy funkadelic rhythms of Toejam and Earl. We discuss the game's origins, it's design, and even some fascinating trivia on the game. Also don't forget we reveal the winner of this weeks competition! While you're here why not head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for Retrograde? We'll even send you a free Limited Edition Retrograde Badge! Also remember to follow us on Twitter and Facebook. If you want to enter this weeks competition simply tweet us @retrogradeshow. So enjoy the show and remember to always check yourself and do not at any time wreck one's self.

item.title: Retrograde #26: Super Mario 64
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode twenty-six of Retrograde, our one year anniversary! So this week we decided to play Super Mario 64. Yes; this time, one year ago, four friends decided to create a retro gaming podcast. Through lack of social lives, a year later, we are still going. So; once again, join me; Jack Marshall and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday, and James MacFadyen as we discuss why we still get together and meet despite utterly hating each other. We also squeeze in a review of Super Mario 64 on the Nintendo 64. Why not head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for Retrograde? We'll even send you a free Limited Edition Retrograde Badge! Also remember to follow us on Twitter and Facebook. Four more years! Four more years! Four more years!

item.title: Retrograde #25: World of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode twenty-five of Retrograde, where this week the team don their Disney tourist outfits and play World of Illusion starring Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck. This week, the Retrograde team sit down to play a game starring arguably the most recognisable character ever created; Mickey Mouse. The Mega-Drive/Genesis exclusive World of Illusion is considered one of the jewels in the crown of Sega's back catalogue, so what better a game for the Retrograde team to destroy to pieces? Join me; Jack Marshall and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday, and James MacFadyen as we attempt to draw ourselves out of the magical paper bag that is World of Illusion. While you're here, why not head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for Retrograde? We'll even send you a free Limited Edition Retrograde Badge! Also remember to follow us on Twitter and Facebook. That's all folks! ... wait, that's Warner Bros. Nailed it.

item.description: Welcome to another episode of Retrograde, where the team try to balance the hospital books a whilst emptying a bed-pan in Theme Hospital. Join Dr. Jack Marshall with co-workers Dr. Lysanne Fisher , Dr. Anthony Hobday, and James MacFadyen as we are about to attempt to pop the bloated head of Theme Hospital by Bullfrog Productions. So; tune in, drop out, and let us cure with our latest episode Retrograde where we play Theme Hospital. Also don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a free Limited Edition Retrograde Badge! Lastly, remember to follow us on Twitter and Facebook, you lucky punters!

item.title: Retrograde #21: Mega-Man
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to another... god damn it... episode of... son of a... Retrograde where this week... oh, what the... the team take on the stupidly difficult... jump you idiot... Mega-Man! Join me; Jack Marshall aka Rock-man, and Lysanne Fisher aka fire-girl and Anthony Hobday aka ice-man as we take on Mega-Man. Sadly James MacFadyen aka Wuss-Man is sick this week, so we drafted in old friend of the show Marc Tourle aka Replacement-Man. So; polish that plasma gun and teleport in with the Retrograde team as we play Mega-Man! Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a free spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge! You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook if you like! Lovely!

item.title: Retrograde #20: Call of Duty
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome, marines, to episode twenty of Retrograde! This week, the Retrograde team lands on Juno Beach as we play Call of Duty! Join me; Jack Marshall, and my personal privateers Lysanne Fisher, James MacFadyen, and Anthony Hobday as we take the fight to the Nazi's front garden. In this episode, we discuss how well Call of Duty has aged, the legacy it began, and discuss the pioneering mechanics of the game. So; polish that BAR, grab that black and white photo of your loved one, and ride the jeep with the Retrograde team as we play Call of Duty! Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a free spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge! You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook if you like! Lovely!

item.title: Retrograde #19: Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.category: Harry Potter and the Philospher's Stone
item.description: Welcome mud-bloods to episode nineteen of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde team gets sorted into Slytherin as we play Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone! Join me; Jack Marshall, and my fellow Hufflepuffs Lysanne Fisher, James MacFadyen, and Anthony Hobday as we expelliarmus our opinions. In this episode, we discuss how well Harry Potter and the Philospher's Stone has aged, the fact that the game was the biggest selling game of all-time on release, the legacy of the game, and dare each other to say "Voldemort". So; grab your wizard wands, that photo of your dead parents, and ride that broom with the Retrograde team as we play Harry Potter and the Philospher's Stone! Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a free spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge! You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook if you like! Lovely!

item.title: Retrograde #18: Quake
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode eighteen of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde team enter medieval hell with Quake! Join me; Jack Marshall, and my fellow comrades Lysanne Fisher, James MacFadyen, and Anthony Hobday as we cock our guns. In this episode, we discuss how well Quake has aged, the Quake engine, the legacy of the game, and the story *giggle* of the game. We're also joined this week by Neil Skinner who, back in the day, was a semi-professional Quake tournament player and who has kindly agreed to join us and share his unique insights into the multi-player world of Quake. So; don the camouflage, polish your nail gun, and rehearse your war face and join the Retrograde team as we play Quake! Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a free spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge! You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook if you like! Lovely!

item.itunes:summary:
Welcome to episode eighteen of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde team enter medieval hell with Quake!
Join me; Jack Marshall, and my fellow comrades Lysanne Fisher, James MacFadyen, and Anthony Hobday as we cock our guns. In this episode, we discuss how well Quake has aged, the Quake engine, the legacy of the game, and the story *giggle* of the game.
We're also joined this week by Neil Skinner who, back in the day, was a semi-professional Quake tournament player and who has kindly agreed to join us and share his unique insights into the multi-player world of Quake.
So; don the camouflage, polish your nail gun, and rehearse your war face and join the Retrograde team as we play Quake! Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a free spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge!
You can also follow us on Twitter and Facebook if you like! Lovely!

item.title: Retrograde #17: The Secret of Monkey Island
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: WelcoARRRRR ... *cough*... Sorry; something was caught in my throat. Welcome to episode seventeen of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde team get silly with The Secret of Monkey Island! Join me; Jack Marshall, and my fellow dairy-farmers Lysanne Fisher, James MacFadyen, and Anthony Hobday as we walk the plank. In this episode, we discuss how well the game has aged, the legacy of the game, Ron Gilbert's thoughts on his baby, and three-headed monkeys. So; hoist the main sail, scrub the poo-deck, and don the skeleton necklace and join the Retrograde team as we play The Secret of Money Island! Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a free spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge! Don't forget to also follow us on Twitter and Facebook!

item.title: Retrograde #16: System Shock 2
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to a slightly delayed episode sixteen of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde get scared silly with System Shock 2. Join me; Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts, Lysanne Fisher and James MacFadyen who are this week joined by games designer Marc Tourle as we take an analytical cyborg eye to the PC classic System Shock 2. In this episode, we discuss how well the game has aged, the legacy of the game, the development process of the game, and why the hell monkeys are throwing fireballs at us. item.title: Retrograde #15.5: Xmas Special 2012
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to the Christmas Special 2012 for Retrograde! The Retrograde team get together, drink, laugh, and try crush each-other in a battle of Retro-goodness to claim the Retrograde cup. Join me, Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday and James MacFadyen as we battle in the first annual Retrograde cup! Overseeing the entire competition we have our special referee Marc Tourle. First up we have a retro gaming quiz filled with far too difficult questions covering all areas of retro gaming. Then each of us deliver up a retro-game as we battle to the death. Well; not to death, but until someone is crying. We have Jump n Bump, Super Bomberman 2, Street Fighter 2 Turbo, and... erm... Bop-It. Also, in the middle we throw in a music-theme round as well as a final deciding lightning round! Who will win!? Who will cry!? And who thought it would be a good idea to drink while we recorded!? So; get those Santa hats on and sit back and enjoy a special Retrograde filled with drunken blurriness and far too much competitiveness. Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge! For the first time ever in Retrograde's history as well we even recorded us playing the games from the Xmas special. You can enjoy these below. First up we have me and James going tooth to tooth over Jump N Bump. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yn_E7hBAAE0 Then we have a vicious and confusing game of Super Bomberman 2. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rzqYa_XTcBU And lastly a scraping time playing Street Fighter 2 Turbo. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RzVTNY-spyM

item.title: Retrograde #15: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.category: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past
item.description: Welcome to episode fifteen of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde fulfil their destiny with The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past. Join me; Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts, Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday and James MacFadyen as we don the Master Sword and go down swinging for The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past. In this episode, we discuss the gameplay, the Zelda universe, and why the hell Jack doesn't like Zelda games. So; make sure you pull on your elf ears and join the Retrograde team as we play A Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past! Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge!

item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode fourteen of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde team suit up and roll out as we play Metal Slug! Join me, Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday and James MacFadyen as we leave boot-camp and experience the horror of war as we play Metal Slug. In this episode we discuss how well the game has aged, the violence, the bloodshed, and brutality of arcades. item.title: Retrograde #13: Goof Troop
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode thirteen of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde team get goofy up in this mother as we play Goof Troop! Join me, Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday and James MacFadyen as we enter a world of shining shimmering splendour in Goof Troop for the Super Nintendo. In this episode we discuss how well the game has aged, the hilarious fact that Anthony and James struggled with a children's puzzle for half-hour, and the tricky topic of just what the hell is Goofy? So; get those Mickey ears on, polish your block kicking shoes, and come join the Retrograde team as we play Goof Troop! Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. item.title: Retrograde #12: Resident Evil
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode twelve of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde team shuffle in, looking for brains and wit, as we play Resident Evil! Join me, Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday and James MacFadyen as we take a zombie to the prom in Resident Evil for the Playstation. In this episode, we discuss how well the game has aged, the notion of Japanese versions compared to the European release, and the legacy of the Resident Evil series. So make a Jill sandwich and run for the mansion while listening to the Retrograde team's latest episode. Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a spiffing Limited Edition Rare Special Edition Super Retrograde Badge!

item.title: Retrograde #11: Crash Bandicoot
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode eleven of Retrograde! This week the Retrograde go in a man down as we take on the chaotic Crash Bandicoot. Join me, Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts Lysanne Fisher and Anthony Hobday as we float on air for the Sony Playstation classic Crash Bandicoot. We discuss the ins and outs of the adorable little marsupial, his intentions towards the wild hogs, and the pronunciation of word bandicoot. So grab the nearest wild hog and ride off into the sunset whilst listening to the Retrograde team's latest podcast episode. Also, don't forget to head over to iTunes and pop a lovely review down for us. We'll even send you a spiffing limited edition rare special edition super Retrograde badge!

item.title: Retrograde #10: Super Mario World 2 – Yoshi’s Island
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode ten of Retrograde! This week for Retrograde the team mix up an omelet using a dash of love, a pinch of smile, and a half-dozen trapped suffocating enemies in eggs as we play Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island. Join me, Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts James McFadyen, Lysanne Fisher and Anthony Hobday as we float on air for the Super Nintendo classic Yoshi's Island. In the show we discuss our recent trip to the Eurogamer Expo in London before sliding in and chatting about the amazing game that is Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island, or - if you're Lysanne - the terrible rip-off that is Yoshi's Island. So; swallow an enemy, lay an egg, then hurl that egg into space... whilst listening to the Retrograde team's latest podcast episode.

item.title: Retrograde #9: Half-Life
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode nine of Retrograde! This week for Retrograde the team battle like a resonance cascade scenario by arguing about the 1998 classic PC game Half-Life. Join me, Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts James McFadyen, Lysanne Fisher and Anthony Hobday as we don a hazardous environment suit and beat the living snot out of helpless aliens in Half-Life. We discuss the ins and outs of the game covering topics such as the legacy of the game, the new Black Mesa Source mod, the great years of gaming of 1997 & 1998, the ethical dilemmas in the game, and even discuss why the hell Gordon Freeman needed a degree from MIT to push a trolley ten feet. So grab a crowbar, smash a crate, and spam F6 as the Retrograde team do Half-life.

Join me, Jack Marshall, and my co-hosts James McFadyen, Lysanne Fisher and Anthony Hobday as we don a hazardous environment suit and beat the living snot out of helpless aliens in Half-Life.
We discuss the ins and outs of the game covering topics such as the legacy of the game, the new Black Mesa Source mod, the great years of gaming of 1997 & 1998, the ethical dilemmas in the game, and even discuss why the hell Gordon Freeman needed a degree from MIT to push a trolley ten feet.
So grab a crowbar, smash a crate, and spam F6 as the Retrograde team do Half-life.
item.itunes:author: The CSICON Network

item.title: Retrograde #8: Super Meat Boy
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode eight of Retrograde! This week we continue the platforming theme with Super Meat Boy. James McFadyen rejoins us this week with his choice of Super Meat Boy chosen, I think, to antagonize myself, Lysanne Fisher, and Anthony Hobday with its fiendishly difficult game-play. So fire up the barbecue, get some steak on, and loosen your belt buttons with the Retrograde team and Super Meat Boy.

item.description: This is episode seven of Retrograde! This week we give a relatively unheard of game called Super Mario World a good hard playing. Oh, we play it hard. Too hard. Due to a poorly James McFadyen, episode seven of Retrograde this week sees myself, Lysanne Fisher, Anthony Hobday, and new-kid-on-the-block Adam Bromage-Hughes take Super Mario World for the Super Nintendo to town. We decided to get it drunk and shave off its moustache. So grab a plunger, unclog that nasty drain, and flush away with the Retrograde team into the world of Super Mario... erm... World.

item.title: Retrograde #6: Kirby Superstar
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: This is episode six of Retrograde! This week we give everyone's favorite pink marshmallow creature thing Kirby a roasting. Episode six of Retrograde this week sees myself, Lysanne Fisher, James McFadyen, and Anthony Hobday take Kirby Superstar for the Super Nintendo out for a spin as the surreal world of Kirby takes its toll on us all. We discuss the difference in box-art between the eastern and western release, the mechanics of the Kirby world, the mini-games within Kirby Superstar, and attempt to answer the one unanswerable question; What the hell is Goofy? So grab a pillow, pop your night cap-on, and drift away with the Retrograde team into the Kirby Super Star world!

item.title: Retrograde #5: Transport Tycoon
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: This is episode five of Retrograde! This week's game is the classic Transport Tycoon! Join us as, this week, we pile aboard the 1994 game Transport Tycoon (well; the 2010 open sourced Transport Tycoon version OpenTTD, to be precise). We'll be discussing the addictive nature of the game, the definition of entertainment, and a discussion into why people play games based around mundane real-world jobs. We also look at the game mechanics where we talk in depth about the mathematics of the game, the advanced signalling available in the game, and we even talk about NeoGaf and their current week of playing Transport Tycoon. Lastly; if you want to play the game don't forget to try the online javascript version of the game. This week's episode is sponsored by Tofu-Testing.com. Tofu-Testing are a freelance QA service for indie teams and bedroom coders set up to embrace the growth in the indie gaming scene. If you have an indie game in the works and would like professional level free QA; head over to Tofu-Testing and get in touch! So; buy a first class ticket, hop aboard, and take a one-way train journey with Retrograde!

item.title: Retrograde #4: Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy’s Kong Quest
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.category: Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest
item.description: Welcome to episode four of Retrograde! For our fourth episode, we take a look back at the classic platformer Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest. Join me - Jack Marshall - and my co-hosts Anthony Hobday, Lysanne Fisher, and James MacFadyen as we jump into a barrel of fun with Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest. Chosen by James MacFadyen this week we cover the tree-tops highs and the swamp lows of Diddy's Kong Quest. We discuss the excellent work performed by the OverClocked Remix Team who remixed the entire soundtrack to the game. Anthony also shares the acoustic arrangement cover performed by Fred Baty of the "Aquatic Ambience" music from the original game. Lastly, we each give our final Retrograde stamp to the game in the form of European cities purely because James didn't choose a grading system in time. This weeks episode is sponsored by DkVine.com. DkVine.com is your one-stop website for everything Donkey Kong related. With a thriving forum community, regular bonkers features, and even two Donkey Kong based podcasts DK Vine really is the only place you'll ever need to visit to get your dose of Donkey Kong. So bang your chest, grab your juggling balls, and swing on the nearest vine and join the Retrograde team as we play Donkey Kong Country 2: Diddy's Kong Quest!

item.title: Retrograde #3: Pokémon Red/Blue
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode three of Retrograde! For our third episode, we take a look back at where Pokémon all began with Pokémon Red and Blue. Join me, Jack Marshall, with my co-hosts Anthony Hobday, Lysanne Fisher, and James MacFadyen as we set our laser sights to the phenomenally successful Pokémon Red and Blue. Chosen by Lysanne Fisher this week we delve into the in and outs of the world of Pokémon Red and Blue where we discuss the morality of the games, the story-line, and of course the strategy involved with the battle cross matrix. We discuss some of the best homages made to Pokemon including Pokemon in Real Life by Smosh.com, PokeAwesome - Just a Pokémon Battle (NSFW language), the Pokemon BeeDrill Rap (again NSFW language), and the syther fail comic strip. We discuss the dedication of some fans who spend days trying to find Shiny Ponytas before delving into the seedy world of the Lavender Town Syndrome. Lastly, we each give our final Retrograde stamp to the game in the form of Pokémon types. This weeks episode is sponsored by Vidyagirls.com. VidyaGirls.com is a new video game community dedicated to funny, informative, and entertaining video game reviews. Whether they be retro or current, PC or console, handheld or smartphone, no game is safe from the piercing insight of the VidyaGirls crew. Make sure to also check out this excellent 'Gotta Review Em' All!' feature focusing on reviewings all the Pokemon games. So grab your pokeballs, kiss your single mother good-bye, and step out into the world of Pokemon Red and Blue with the Retrograde crew!

item.title: Retrograde #2: Gunstar Heroes
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: Welcome to episode two of Retrograde! For our second episode, we take a look at the run-and-gun platformer Gunstar Heroes. Join me, Jack Marshall, with my co-hosts Anthony Hobday, Lysanne Fisher, and James MacFadyen as we set our laser sights to the 1993 classic run-and-gun platformer Gunstar Heroes. Chosen by Anthony Hobday; this week we discuss the ins and outs of the pixel luscious Gunstar Heroes for Genesis/Mega Drive. We discuss the game's now legendary soundtrack which, as mentioned by Lysanne Fisher in the show, has been covered in many various forms, including a heavy-metal cover. We go into detail over the offline co-op in the game and discuss the history of the development studio Treasure. Lastly, we each give our final Retrograde stamp to the game with some surprisingly varied results. Tune in and retro up to episode two of Retrograde! Make sure to tune in and explode out!

item.title: Retrograde #1: Super Mario Kart
item.dc:creator: Jack Marshall
item.description: This is episode one of the brand new podcast to the CSICON network; Retrograde! For our first ever episode we take a look at the racing classic Super Mario Kart. Join me, Jack Marshall, with my co-hosts Anthony Hobday, Lysanne Fisher, and James MacFadyen as, this week, we take a microscope made of pixels to the 1992 classic racer Super Mario Kart for the Super Nintendo. We go over the legacy of the game as well as discussing its own sequels and numerous rip-offs. We also delve into the world of Mario Kart weaponry, magic, and characters.Lastly we ask some of the most important questions to plague Mario kart: Was this the best Mario Kart game of the series? How did Donkey Kong Jr steer with his arms in the air? How comes a guy is allowed to drive around in real-life re-enacting Mario Kart? And was no-one else disturbed by Koopa Troopa throwing the bodies of his brethern at his enemies? Tune in and retro up to episode one of Retrograde!
